medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hypoparathyroidism developed following neck surgeries for primary hyperparathyroidism and total thyroidectomy for Graves' disease. Symptoms persisted for 8 to 16 years before recovery, with fluctuations in calcium and PTH levels noted during the treatment period with PTH(1â€“84).
medical_history.past_medical_history: Primary hyperparathyroidism, Graves' disease, history of multiple neck surgeries (including parathyroid and thyroid gland resections), nephrolithiasis observed prior to hypoparathyroidism for some cases.
medical_history.family_history: Significant family history includes an identical twin sister with primary hyperparathyroidism.
